{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2011}} {{Use Australian English|date=August 2011}} {{BLP sources|date=July 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = Tom Burlinson | image = Sharon Davson and Tom Burlinson.jpg | caption = Tom Burlinson (right) | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1956|2|14}} | birth_place = [[Toronto]], Canada | othername = | occupation = Actor | yearsactive = 1977â2003 | spouse = Mandy Carnie (1996âpresent) 3 children | domesticpartner = | website = }} '''Tom Burlinson''' (born 14 February 1956, in Toronto, Canada) is an Australian actor and singer.
He attended Pittwater High School on Sydney's Northern Beaches and was the School Captain in his final year. Starting 1979 he played Mickey Pratt in the teen-oriented Australian [[soap opera]] ''[[The Restless Years]]''.
He appeared as Jim Craig ("The Man") in both the 1982 Australian movie ''[[The Man from Snowy River (1982 film)|The Man from Snowy River]]'', and its 1988 sequel ''[[The Man from Snowy River II]]'', which has the [[United States]] title of ''Return to Snowy River'' and the [[United Kingdom|British]] title of ''The Untamed''. He portrayed [[horse trainer]] [[Tommy Woodcock]] in ''[[Phar Lap (film)|Phar Lap: Heart of a Nation]]''.<ref>[http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=EXIeAAAAIBAJ&sjid=M2kEAAAAIBAJ&pg=6679,3175270&dq=tom+burlinson&hl=en Canadian-born Actor Tom Burlinson Takes Australian Limelight in Filmâ]</ref>
He is also a singer, and has sung in concerts on stage as [[Frank Sinatra]].<ref>[http://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2008/04/20/2221650.htm Weekends Performer - Tom Burlinson]</ref> He provided Sinatra's singing voice in the 2003 Australian movie ''[[The Night We Called It a Day (film)|The Night We Called It a Day]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117921531/ |title=The Night We Called it a Day |author=Stratton, David |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] | date=13 August 2003 |accessdate=2011-07-18 }}</ref>
From 2007 to 2009, Burlinson was a judge on the Australian reality TV show ''[[Australia's Got Talent]]'' along with [[Dannii Minogue]] and [[Red Symons]].<ref>[http://www.smh.com.au/news/entertainmant/tv/2010/02/04/1265151930786.html Kyle Sandilands returns to television]</ref>
